CarePlan.name: basedOn
CarePlan.definition: A care plan that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this care plan.

CarePlan.name: replaces
CarePlan.definition: Completed or terminated care plan whose function is taken by this new care plan.

CarePlan.name: partOf
CarePlan.definition: A larger care plan of which this particular care plan is a component or step.

CarePlan.name: basedOn
CarePlan.definition: A list of the diagnostic requests that resulted in this imaging study being performed.

CarePlan.definition: A plan or request that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this medication request.

CarePlan.name: basedOn
CarePlan.definition: A plan, proposal or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this event.  For example, a MedicationRequest may require a patient to have laboratory test performed before  it is dispensed.

Condition.name: addresses
Condition.definition: Identifies the conditions/problems/concerns/diagnoses/etc. whose management and/or mitigation are handled by this plan.

Condition.name: reasonReference
Condition.definition: Indicates another resource, such as the health condition(s), whose existence justifies this request and drove the inclusion of this particular activity as part of the plan.

Condition.name: diagnosisReference
Condition.definition: The nature of illness or problem in a coded form or as a reference to an external defined Condition.

Condition.name: reasonReference
Condition.definition: Reason the encounter takes place, expressed as a code. For admissions, this can be used for a coded admission diagnosis.

Condition.name: condition
Condition.definition: Reason the encounter takes place, as specified using information from another resource. For admissions, this is the admission diagnosis. The indication will typically be a Condition (with other resources referenced in the evidence.detail), or a Procedure.

Condition.name: diagnosisReference
Condition.definition: The nature of illness or problem in a coded form or as a reference to an external defined Condition.

Condition.name: reasonReference
Condition.definition: Indicates another resource whose existence justifies this Study.

Condition.name: reasonReference
Condition.definition: Condition, Observation or DiagnosticReport that supports why the immunization was administered.

Condition.name: reasonReference
Condition.definition: Condition or observation that supports why the medication was ordered.

Resource.name: supportingInfo
Resource.definition: Identifies portions of the patient's record that specifically influenced the formation of the plan.  These might include comorbidities, recent procedures, limitations, recent assessments, etc.

Resource.name: outcomeReference
Resource.definition: Details of the outcome or action resulting from the activity.  The reference to an "event" resource, such as Procedure or Encounter or Observation, is the result/outcome of the activity itself.  The activity can be conveyed using CarePlan.activity.detail OR using the CarePlan.activity.reference (a reference to a request resource).

Resource.name: valueReference
Resource.definition: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.

Resource.name: detail
Resource.definition: Links to other relevant information, including pathology reports.

Resource.name: valueReference
Resource.definition: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.

Resource.name: supportingInformation
Resource.definition: Include additional information (for example, patient height and weight) that supports the ordering of the medication.

Resource.name: focus
Resource.definition: The actual focus of an observation when it is not the patient of record representing something or someone associated with the patient such as a spouse, parent, fetus, or donor. For example, fetus observations in a mother's record.  The focus of an observation could also be an existing condition,  an intervention, the subject's diet,  another observation of the subject,  or a body structure such as tumor or implanted device.   An example use case would be using the Observation resource to capture whether the mother is trained to change her child's tracheostomy tube. In this example, the child is the patient of record and the mother is the focus.

Goal.name: goal
Goal.definition: Describes the intended objective(s) of carrying out the care plan.

Goal.name: goal
Goal.definition: Internal reference that identifies the goals that this activity is intended to contribute towards meeting.

Appointment.name: reference
Appointment.definition: The details of the proposed activity represented in a specific resource.

Appointment.name: appointment
Appointment.definition: The appointment that scheduled this encounter.

Appointment.name: basedOn
Appointment.definition: A list of the diagnostic requests that resulted in this imaging study being performed.

CommunicationRequest.name: reference
CommunicationRequest.definition: The details of the proposed activity represented in a specific resource.

DeviceRequest.name: reference
DeviceRequest.definition: The details of the proposed activity represented in a specific resource.

DeviceRequest.name: prescription
DeviceRequest.definition: Prescription to support the dispensing of pharmacy, device or vision products.

DeviceRequest.name: originalPrescription
DeviceRequest.definition: Original prescription which has been superseded by this prescription to support the dispensing of pharmacy services, medications or products.

DeviceRequest.name: basedOn
DeviceRequest.definition: A plan, proposal or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this event.  For example, a MedicationRequest may require a patient to have laboratory test performed before  it is dispensed.

MedicationRequest.name: reference
MedicationRequest.definition: The details of the proposed activity represented in a specific resource.

MedicationRequest.name: prescription
MedicationRequest.definition: Prescription to support the dispensing of pharmacy, device or vision products.

MedicationRequest.name: originalPrescription
MedicationRequest.definition: Original prescription which has been superseded by this prescription to support the dispensing of pharmacy services, medications or products.

MedicationRequest.name: prescription
MedicationRequest.definition: Prescription to support the dispensing of pharmacy, device or vision products.

MedicationRequest.name: originalPrescription
MedicationRequest.definition: Original prescription which has been superseded by this prescription to support the dispensing of pharmacy services, medications or products.

MedicationRequest.name: basedOn
MedicationRequest.definition: A plan or request that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this medication request.

MedicationRequest.name: priorPrescription
MedicationRequest.definition: A link to a resource representing an earlier order related order or prescription.

MedicationRequest.name: basedOn
MedicationRequest.definition: A plan, proposal or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this event.  For example, a MedicationRequest may require a patient to have laboratory test performed before  it is dispensed.

NutritionOrder.name: reference
NutritionOrder.definition: The details of the proposed activity represented in a specific resource.

NutritionOrder.name: basedOn
NutritionOrder.definition: A plan, proposal or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this event.  For example, a MedicationRequest may require a patient to have laboratory test performed before  it is dispensed.

Task.name: reference
Task.definition: The details of the proposed activity represented in a specific resource.

Task.name: basedOn
Task.definition: A list of the diagnostic requests that resulted in this imaging study being performed.

ServiceRequest.name: reference
ServiceRequest.definition: The details of the proposed activity represented in a specific resource.

ServiceRequest.name: referral
ServiceRequest.definition: A reference to a referral resource.

ServiceRequest.name: basedOn
ServiceRequest.definition: The request this encounter satisfies (e.g. incoming referral or procedure request).

ServiceRequest.name: referral
ServiceRequest.definition: A reference to a referral resource.

ServiceRequest.name: basedOn
ServiceRequest.definition: A list of the diagnostic requests that resulted in this imaging study being performed.

ServiceRequest.name: basedOn
ServiceRequest.definition: A plan or request that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this medication request.

ServiceRequest.name: basedOn
ServiceRequest.definition: A plan, proposal or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this event.  For example, a MedicationRequest may require a patient to have laboratory test performed before  it is dispensed.

VisionPrescription.name: reference
VisionPrescription.definition: The details of the proposed activity represented in a specific resource.

VisionPrescription.name: prescription
VisionPrescription.definition: Prescription to support the dispensing of pharmacy, device or vision products.

VisionPrescription.name: originalPrescription
VisionPrescription.definition: Original prescription which has been superseded by this prescription to support the dispensing of pharmacy services, medications or products.

VisionPrescription.name: prescription
VisionPrescription.definition: Prescription to support the dispensing of pharmacy, device or vision products.

RequestGroup.name: reference
RequestGroup.definition: The details of the proposed activity represented in a specific resource.

Observation.name: reasonReference
Observation.definition: Indicates another resource, such as the health condition(s), whose existence justifies this request and drove the inclusion of this particular activity as part of the plan.

Observation.name: assessment
Observation.definition: Reference to a formal record of the evidence on which the staging assessment is based.

Observation.name: result
Observation.definition: [Observations](observation.html)  that are part of this diagnostic report.

Observation.name: reasonReference
Observation.definition: Reason the encounter takes place, expressed as a code. For admissions, this can be used for a coded admission diagnosis.

Observation.name: reasonReference
Observation.definition: Indicates another resource whose existence justifies this Study.

Observation.name: reasonReference
Observation.definition: Condition, Observation or DiagnosticReport that supports why the immunization was administered.

Observation.name: reasonReference
Observation.definition: Condition or observation that supports why the medication was ordered.

Observation.name: hasMember
Observation.definition: This observation is a group observation (e.g. a battery, a panel of tests, a set of vital sign measurements) that includes the target as a member of the group.

Observation.name: derivedFrom
Observation.definition: The target resource that represents a measurement from which this observation value is derived. For example, a calculated anion gap or a fetal measurement based on an ultrasound image.

DiagnosticReport.name: reasonReference
DiagnosticReport.definition: Indicates another resource, such as the health condition(s), whose existence justifies this request and drove the inclusion of this particular activity as part of the plan.

DiagnosticReport.name: assessment
DiagnosticReport.definition: Reference to a formal record of the evidence on which the staging assessment is based.

DiagnosticReport.name: reasonReference
DiagnosticReport.definition: Indicates another resource whose existence justifies this Study.

DiagnosticReport.name: reasonReference
DiagnosticReport.definition: Condition, Observation or DiagnosticReport that supports why the immunization was administered.

DocumentReference.name: reasonReference
DocumentReference.definition: Indicates another resource, such as the health condition(s), whose existence justifies this request and drove the inclusion of this particular activity as part of the plan.

DocumentReference.name: reasonReference
DocumentReference.definition: Indicates another resource whose existence justifies this Study.

DocumentReference.name: derivedFrom
DocumentReference.definition: The target resource that represents a measurement from which this observation value is derived. For example, a calculated anion gap or a fetal measurement based on an ultrasound image.

Location.name: location
Location.definition: Identifies the facility where the activity will occur; e.g. home, hospital, specific clinic, etc.

Location.name: facility
Location.definition: Facility where the services were provided.

Location.name: locationReference
Location.definition: The physical location of the accident event.

Location.name: locationReference
Location.definition: Where the product or service was provided.

Location.name: subject
Location.definition: The subject of the report. Usually, but not always, this is a patient. However, diagnostic services also perform analyses on specimens collected from a variety of other sources.

Location.name: origin
Location.definition: The location/organization from which the patient came before admission.

Location.name: destination
Location.definition: Location/organization to which the patient is discharged.

Location.name: location
Location.definition: The location where the encounter takes place.

Location.name: facility
Location.definition: Facility where the services were provided.

Location.name: locationReference
Location.definition: The physical location of the accident event.

Location.name: locationReference
Location.definition: Where the product or service was provided.

Location.name: locationReference
Location.definition: Where the product or service was provided.

Location.name: location
Location.definition: The principal physical location where the ImagingStudy was performed.

Location.name: location
Location.definition: The service delivery location where the vaccine administration occurred.

Location.name: subject
Location.definition: The patient, or group of patients, location, or device this observation is about and into whose record the observation is placed. If the actual focus of the observation is different from the subject (or a sample of, part, or region of the subject), the `focus` element or the `code` itself specifies the actual focus of the observation.

HealthcareService.name: performer
HealthcareService.definition: Identifies who's expected to be involved in the activity.

Medication.name: productReference
Medication.definition: Identifies the food, drug or other product to be consumed or supplied in the activity.

Medication.name: medicationReference
Medication.definition: Identifies the medication being requested. This is a link to a resource that represents the medication which may be the details of the medication or simply an attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.

Substance.name: productReference
Substance.definition: Identifies the food, drug or other product to be consumed or supplied in the activity.

Claim.name: claim
Claim.definition: The business identifier for the instance of the adjudication request: claim predetermination or preauthorization.

Procedure.name: procedureReference
Procedure.definition: The code or reference to a Procedure resource which identifies the clinical intervention performed.

Procedure.name: reasonReference
Procedure.definition: Reason the encounter takes place, expressed as a code. For admissions, this can be used for a coded admission diagnosis.

Procedure.name: condition
Procedure.definition: Reason the encounter takes place, as specified using information from another resource. For admissions, this is the admission diagnosis. The indication will typically be a Condition (with other resources referenced in the evidence.detail), or a Procedure.

Procedure.name: procedureReference
Procedure.definition: The code or reference to a Procedure resource which identifies the clinical intervention performed.

Procedure.name: procedureReference
Procedure.definition: The procedure which this ImagingStudy was part of.

Procedure.name: partOf
Procedure.definition: A larger event of which this particular Observation is a component or step.  For example,  an observation as part of a procedure.

Coverage.name: coverage
Coverage.definition: Reference to the insurance card level information contained in the Coverage resource. The coverage issuing insurer will use these details to locate the patient's actual coverage within the insurer's information system.

Coverage.name: coverage
Coverage.definition: Reference to the insurance card level information contained in the Coverage resource. The coverage issuing insurer will use these details to locate the patient's actual coverage within the insurer's information system.

Coverage.name: insurance
Coverage.definition: Insurance plans, coverage extensions, pre-authorizations and/or pre-determinations that may be required for delivering the requested service.

ClaimResponse.name: claimResponse
ClaimResponse.definition: The result of the adjudication of the line items for the Coverage specified in this insurance.

ClaimResponse.name: claimResponse
ClaimResponse.definition: The business identifier for the instance of the adjudication response: claim, predetermination or preauthorization response.

ClaimResponse.name: insurance
ClaimResponse.definition: Insurance plans, coverage extensions, pre-authorizations and/or pre-determinations that may be required for delivering the requested service.

ClinicalImpression.name: assessment
ClinicalImpression.definition: Reference to a formal record of the evidence on which the staging assessment is based.

Contract.name: contract
Contract.definition: The policy(s) which constitute this insurance coverage.

ImmunizationRecommendation.name: reasonReference
ImmunizationRecommendation.definition: Reason the encounter takes place, expressed as a code. For admissions, this can be used for a coded admission diagnosis.

ImmunizationRecommendation.name: basedOn
ImmunizationRecommendation.definition: A plan or request that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this medication request.

ImmunizationRecommendation.name: basedOn
ImmunizationRecommendation.definition: A plan, proposal or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this event.  For example, a MedicationRequest may require a patient to have laboratory test performed before  it is dispensed.

Specimen.name: specimen
Specimen.definition: Details about the specimens on which this diagnostic report is based.

Specimen.name: specimen
Specimen.definition: The specimen imaged, e.g., for whole slide imaging of a biopsy.

Specimen.name: specimen
Specimen.definition: The specimen that was used when this observation was made.

ImagingStudy.name: imagingStudy
ImagingStudy.definition: One or more links to full details of any imaging performed during the diagnostic investigation. Typically, this is imaging performed by DICOM enabled modalities, but this is not required. A fully enabled PACS viewer can use this information to provide views of the source images.

ImagingStudy.name: partOf
ImagingStudy.definition: A larger event of which this particular Observation is a component or step.  For example,  an observation as part of a procedure.

ImagingStudy.name: derivedFrom
ImagingStudy.definition: The target resource that represents a measurement from which this observation value is derived. For example, a calculated anion gap or a fetal measurement based on an ultrasound image.

Media.name: reasonReference
Media.definition: Indicates another resource whose existence justifies this Study.

Media.name: derivedFrom
Media.definition: The target resource that represents a measurement from which this observation value is derived. For example, a calculated anion gap or a fetal measurement based on an ultrasound image.

EpisodeOfCare.name: episodeOfCare
EpisodeOfCare.definition: Where a specific encounter should be classified as a part of a specific episode(s) of care this field should be used. This association can facilitate grouping of related encounters together for a specific purpose, such as government reporting, issue tracking, association via a common problem.  The association is recorded on the encounter as these are typically created after the episode of care and grouped on entry rather than editing the episode of care to append another encounter to it (the episode of care could span years).

Account.name: account
Account.definition: The set of accounts that may be used for billing for this Encounter.

AppointmentResponse.name: basedOn
AppointmentResponse.definition: A list of the diagnostic requests that resulted in this imaging study being performed.

Endpoint.name: endpoint
Endpoint.definition: The network service providing access (e.g., query, view, or retrieval) for the study. See implementation notes for information about using DICOM endpoints. A study-level endpoint applies to each series in the study, unless overridden by a series-level endpoint with the same Endpoint.connectionType.

Endpoint.name: endpoint
Endpoint.definition: The network service providing access (e.g., query, view, or retrieval) for this series. See implementation notes for information about using DICOM endpoints. A series-level endpoint, if present, has precedence over a study-level endpoint with the same Endpoint.connectionType.

DetectedIssue.name: detectedIssue
DetectedIssue.definition: Indicates an actual or potential clinical issue with or between one or more active or proposed clinical actions for a patient; e.g. Drug-drug interaction, duplicate therapy, dosage alert etc.

Provenance.name: eventHistory
Provenance.definition: Links to Provenance records for past versions of this resource or fulfilling request or event resources that identify key state transitions or updates that are likely to be relevant to a user looking at the current version of the resource.

MedicationAdministration.name: partOf
MedicationAdministration.definition: A larger event of which this particular Observation is a component or step.  For example,  an observation as part of a procedure.

MedicationDispense.name: partOf
MedicationDispense.definition: A larger event of which this particular Observation is a component or step.  For example,  an observation as part of a procedure.

MedicationStatement.name: partOf
MedicationStatement.definition: A larger event of which this particular Observation is a component or step.  For example,  an observation as part of a procedure.

Immunization.name: partOf
Immunization.definition: A larger event of which this particular Observation is a component or step.  For example,  an observation as part of a procedure.

DeviceMetric.name: device
DeviceMetric.definition: The device used to generate the observation data.

QuestionnaireResponse.name: hasMember
QuestionnaireResponse.definition: This observation is a group observation (e.g. a battery, a panel of tests, a set of vital sign measurements) that includes the target as a member of the group.

QuestionnaireResponse.name: derivedFrom
QuestionnaireResponse.definition: The target resource that represents a measurement from which this observation value is derived. For example, a calculated anion gap or a fetal measurement based on an ultrasound image.

MolecularSequence.name: hasMember
MolecularSequence.definition: This observation is a group observation (e.g. a battery, a panel of tests, a set of vital sign measurements) that includes the target as a member of the group.

MolecularSequence.name: derivedFrom
MolecularSequence.definition: The target resource that represents a measurement from which this observation value is derived. For example, a calculated anion gap or a fetal measurement based on an ultrasound image.
